snippet: With the Muslim Brotherhood in reach of an outright majority in Egypt’s parliament, the Obama administration has begun to shift from decades of hostility toward it.
abstract: Obama administration has begun to reverse decades of mistrust and hostility as it seeks to forge closer ties with Egypt's Muslim Brotherhood, which was once viewed as irreconcilably opposed to United States interests; administration's overtures are an acknowledgement of the new political reality in both Egypt and the region, but also reflect the administration's growing acceptance of the Brotherhood's repeated assurances that its lawmakers want to build a modern democracy.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: With the Muslim Brotherhood in reach of an outright majority in Egypt’s parliament, the Obama administration has begun to shift from decades of hostility toward it.

headline.seo: U.S. Reverses Policy in Reaching Out to Muslim Brotherhood
headline.main: Overtures to Egypt’s Islamists Reverse Longtime U.S. Policy
headline.print_headline: Overtures to Egypt’s Islamists Reverse Longtime U.S. Policy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
